I see, Again thanks for explaining!
But for this PR I don't think we should introduce FloatBeforeAfterEvent just for a getChange/Factor() method...
The whole point of using generics I think is we don't need to have separate events for different datatypes..
So I think we can leave those separate functionalities to the specific events that extend this event.
